page.title: 08Clifton Bank Farm, Plumpton
page.content:
The farm is situated in the village of Great Plumpton. It was formerly part of the Clifton family's South Fylde estate and was bought by the present owner's father in 1936.
It is one of eight farms in the area.{Until the mid-l950s it was a {dairy farm,}with about 20 acres of arable land.
Today,{barley}is grown in 175 acres. This is turned into fodder in the farm's own miller-mix plant.
About 1000{pigs}are bred for their pork: live weight is 150-160 lbs and dead weight about 110 lbs.
The farm is managed by two brothers, with the help of one full-time and one part-time labourer.
